bibl.title: Letter from Robert Carter to John Gale, June 27, 1727

div1.p: Robert Carter writes a friendly letter to Glasgow merchant John Gale, June 27, 1727, because he has the opportunity by a Glasgow ship, wishing Gale well, and asking his help in obtaining a gardener.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Carter to John Gale, June 27, 1727

opener.dateline:
[Rappahannock, Lancaster County, Virginia]
June the 27th. 1727
Mr. John Gale

div1.p:
I do not find I have answered your favr: of the
10th of November by Capt: Kelsick I am in no doubt of your doing yor:
best Endeavour in the Dispose of my 12 hhds: by the Crown The goodness
of the Tobbo: I am in hopes hath Carryed it of at the Top of your market
Yor: Countryman Bowman taking his leave of me this day I thot
it proper to give you the trouble of this Line wishing you all Imagin
able prosperity I am
div1.closer:
Sir, Yor: most humble Servt:
I am yet in want of a Gardner &
Should be obliged to you if you can
procure one for me
per Capt: Bowman

div1.head: NOTES
div1.note: Source copy consulted: Robert Carter letter book, 1727 May-1728 July, Robert Carter Papers (acc. no. 3807), Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia.

Robert Carter generally used a return address of "Rappahannock" for the river on which he lived rather than "Corotoman," the name of his home, on his correspondence, especially to merchants abroad. The county and colony have been added for clarity.
[1] John Gale was a Glasgow merchant about whom has little been discovered. Carter would write him several times in the period 1727-1729.
[2] Richard Kelsick was captain of the Mazareen as noted in Carter's diary entry for 1727 January 19.
[3] Captain Samuel Bowman commanded the Lucia. Carter mentioned this vessel in his diary in June 1724, and again on 1726 March 4 when he wrote that she "came in had 20 Weeks Passage."
